2054.subject: BUS
2054.descrlong: Covers the principles and practices of managing a not-for-profit organization. Knowledge areas include strategic planning, human resource management, ethics and social responsibility, volunteer development, and influences of multiple stakeholders. In addition to reflecting on these topics, students examine actual practices of community organizations in education, health care, social services, and the arts, and engage in service learning in a designated community organization. Satisfies the upper-division service learning requirement. Formerly MIE 433S. (Offered only as interest warrants.)
